info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 18 at 2:51PM EDT until July 18 at 3:15PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM EDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN WASHINGTON...NORTH CENTRAL LOUDOUN...NORTHEASTERN JEFFERSON AND SOUTHEASTERN BERKELEY COUNTIES... At 250 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Shepherdstown to Berryville, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. Locations impacted include... Charles Town, Shepherdstown, Ranson, Harpers Ferry, Kearneysville, Corporation Of Ranson, Bolivar, Sharpsburg, Shenandoah Junction, Rohrersville, Gapland, Brownsville, Antietam, Neersville, Moler Crossroads, Halltown, Pleasantville, Millville and Bakerton. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
